alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 24 at 10:16PM CST until January 24 at 11:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... * Until 1100 PM CST. * At 1016 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Covington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Slidell, Bogalusa, Covington, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Bush, Lacombe, Enon, Crossroads and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 49 and 80. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southern Mississippi.
